data.name: Jurassic Snap
data.detailed_description:
A New World Is Waiting For You ...


Congratulations photographer , you have been selected to visit the most recent discovery, Gliese 486B.
On this exoplanet similar to Earth, time has stood still. Indeed, the creatures that populate it are similar to dinosaurs!

Before long, the Earth will become uninhabitable. Your work is therefore essential: your photos will serve us for research and, thanks to you, we will be able to determine whether humans are able to coexist with the surrounding fauna.

You will be responsible for taking the best pictures of the dinos so that we can study them and learn as much as possible about them.
You will join Professor Edmée who will be responsible for evaluating your photos on various scientific criteria such as diet, size, lifestyle, etc. These data will then be entered in the Dinopedia .

Complete the Dinopedia!


Our goal in sending you to this planet is to complete this encyclopedia 100%!
The Dinopedia will serve as a database and the photos taken indicating specific data will all be included.
However, you will be able to make a selection of your favorite photos and save them.

Become a space influencer!


You are free to share your favorite pictures on your networks, however the various reactions aroused will not be relevant for the progress of science.
Yet I wonder how Earthlings will react to the sight of creatures over 8 meters tall!

The various conditions!


While browsing Gliese, you will rarely have the same interactions with dinos. Indeed, you may not always meet the same ones, depending on the weather conditions but also if you go day or night.
Finally, creatures will not always have the same situations simply because of the hazard of nature and how you will impact it with your baits and repellents.

Adapt to every situation!


In order to get the best visuals, we will provide you with essential tools such as baits, repellents and luminescent balls that will help you create the ideal situation for you.

Use the baits to attract the dinos you choose to snap.
A herbivore will be insensitive or even flee if you throw bait intended for carnivores.
Sending bait to carnis could instead distract them from their original target.

About repellents, they are effective against most creatures and are useful in different situations such as repelling the attack of a carni in extremis or bringing out creatures that would be hiding in a stash.

At this point you will be completely free to use them, so be creative !
But remember that some dinos may not react as you expected …

Henri, your personal assistant!


Rest assured you will not be in danger!
Thanks to the AI ​​ Henri and your antigravity vehicle, you will be safe from the most virulent reactions. Your personal assistant will evacuate you at the slightest problem!
Thus, Henri’s company could sometimes be useful, as he offers you advices.
Just so you know, he sometimes tries to make jokes. We are sorry in advance for that.

Go on an adventure, photographer, and have a good flight!

data.short_description: Congratulations photographer , you have been selected for the mission on Gliese 486B . In order to study the creatures similar to the dinosaurs that live there, you will take pictures of them and we will study their behavior. So we will see if humans are able to cohabit.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel Core I5
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RTX 2060
